channel.name: Proposal for Standard Interface for Smart Contract Wallet

messages.content: hey 👋 we’ve received a grant to build a token standard exactly like this, we’ll be sharing a lot more in the coming week 👌
where did you post it?
It was discussed as part of zk ignite cohort 1, but we’ve received a grant about a month and a half ago 👌
there is quite a lot more to consider, i hope our solution will be comprehensive enough for your wallet implementation
but it's not the same as ERC20 Standard. the interface is not the same
We need some discussions about this as dev community
why wouldnt it be?
not sure thou, can you send me link of the proposal/ discussions?
as i originally said, we'll publish more info in the following week 👌 i'll keep you posted
@maht0rz @IaM [ZK] <DEV> has this issue been solved?
We have to wait till @maht0rz publish his token standard
No worries thank you @IaM [ZK] <DEV>

I like it! Comments / questions:

* Would it make sense to merge the 'withdraw" and "transfer" events? And add a token id to them? They seem to signal the same thing - balance transfer from this account of a specific token

* I agree there should be a standard token interface for Mina which has methods like 'transfer', but we shouldn't call it ERC20 to avoid confusion. ERC20 contains some concepts that are specific to Ethereum (approval / allowance) and don't make that much sense on Mina, and would also be hard to implement on Mina

* What would it mean to call `deposit(amount)`? Is the intention to trigger some UI screen where the user can copy their address from?
We're already working on an MIP for a token stadnard as a MF grantee, will publish a full MIP post this week, here's a sneak peak: https://github.com/stove-labs/mip-token-standard

embeds.title: GitHub - stove-labs/mip-token-standard
embeds.description: Contribute to stove-labs/mip-token-standard development by creating an account on GitHub.

messages.content: I agree with gregor that deposit/withdraw is a transfer from/to and therefore i also think the token standard is covering a 'wallet' too, unless there's more. and if there is more it should be made part of our MIP i think 🙂

Unfortunately this is not what I’m looking for. We need to agree on interfaces not on implementation. We need to speaks the same languages so we prevent multiple interfaces for the same functions. Do we have a great place to discuss this? Can we put it as RFC or MIP?
We also have to agree on how to deal with multiple implementations due to technical details around verification keys / provers. The standard interface itself is far from enough.
Sure but we have to focus. There are a lot we have to discuss and makes agreement. We need to find a place where developers can talk and discuss about this.
how about starting a discussion on minaresearch.com?
And link from here since many people might not monitor that forum

* yes it’s makes sense to use Transfer for both. But how do we know the difference between token and Mina events? Events will be used to analyse zkApp. We should remove ERC20. Deposit will be use to deposit Mina to a smart contract, like for staking, defi or to a smart contract wallet. Do we need some kind of secret/key/ identification for deposit? For example if a defi protocol needs to check the user?

> how about starting a discussion on minaresearch.com?

Or maybe we should have a place for discussing proposals / RFCs from within discord. 
Curious about @CalebCurry's and @angus_m's thoughts

Or maybe use Github (something lighter than the MIP repo probably)

We can start a channel or a forum like the Q&A one, but for MIPs? I can imagine Discord being a good place for freeform and casual discussion of ideas and such. We could do that with a channel, sessions on the zkapps-hangout voice channel, or a forum.

I think the issue with Discord is that it is not as easily sorted and searchable as GitHub.

Yeah I have to agree on the searchability. A well-considered discussion about a MIP or other proposal should be accessible to the public forever, google-able etc. Discord isn't suitable for that, Github makes more sense. But the free-form discussion around such a proposal could indeed live here in a Q&A like channel, or maybe we could abuse the Q&A channel for that

> But how do we know the difference between token and Mina events?
MINA is a token. There's no big difference at the protocol layer between MINA and other tokens, except for the token authorization rules, which MINA is excempt from.
So I would just add a field "token id" to the event. The MINA token id is 1, FYI.

> Deposit will be use to deposit Mina to a smart contract, like for staking, defi or to a smart contract wallet. Do we need some kind of secret/key/ identification for deposit? For example if a defi protocol needs to check the user? 
I understand! But deposit from where? Is the intention that the user is connected to the website with a normal wallet, and is asked to confirm a transfer from the normal wallet into the smart contract wallet?

Also, @IaM [ZK] <DEV>, why is 'deposit' a 'mutation that needs @method'? Shouldn't you just be able to deposit into the smart contract wallet from anywhere, without authorization by the receiving wallet?
Yes sending from normal user wallet to smart contract wallet. You probably are right about that, if that is possible,so can you tell me how to deposit to an zkApp?
